organization: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi
attackMethod: Malware encryption (1.3 TB data across 5 servers)
rootCause: Vulnerable IT infrastructure, possible phishing, inadequate network segmentation
impact: Disruption of hospital services (e.g., appointments, lab results) for 12 days; 40 million patient records at risk; no ransom demanded
description:
On November 23, 2022, AIIMS Delhi was hit by a ransomware attack encrypting 1.3 TB of data across five servers, disrupting services like e-Hospital, lab reports, and OPD for 12 days. No ransom was demanded, and data was restored from backups. The attack exposed healthcare infrastructure vulnerabilities.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown ransomware group
- Targets: AIIMS IT systems
- Motivation: Disruption/extortion
- Consequence: Partial recovery in 2 weeks, full in 2 months; ongoing probe

description:
In December 2022, RailYatri, an Indian Railways e-booking app, suffered a breach exposing 30 million user records. The data was leaked on BreachForums; RailYatri denied sensitive data access but confirmed an incident.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown threat actor
- Targets: RailYatri database
- Motivation: Data theft for sale
- Consequence: User notifications, security audit
